content.text: Bash ssh Command - OpenSSH SSH Client
Using the ssh Command
The ssh command is used to connect to a remote machine securely.
content.html: The ssh command is used to connect to a remote machine securely.

content.text: Basic Usage
To connect to a remote host, use ssh user@hostname :
content.html: To connect to a remote host, use ssh user@hostname:

content.code:
ssh
user@example.com
Linux raspberrypi 6.6.74+rpt-rpi-2712 #1 SMP PREEMPT Debian 1:6.6.74-1+rpt1 (2025-01-27) aarch64

The programs included with the Debian GNU/Linux system are free software;
the exact distribution terms for each program are described in the
individual files in /usr/share/doc/*/copyright.

Debian GNU/Linux comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY, to the extent
permitted by applicable law.
Last login: Thu Apr 10 13:09:32 2025 from 45.14.193.140
user@example.com:~ $
content.code_html:
ssh user@example.com
Linux raspberrypi 6.6.74+rpt-rpi-2712 #1 SMP PREEMPT Debian 1:6.6.74-1+rpt1 (2025-01-27) aarch64

The programs included with the Debian GNU/Linux system are free software;
the exact distribution terms for each program are described in the
individual files in /usr/share/doc/*/copyright.

Debian GNU/Linux comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY, to the extent
permitted by applicable law.
Last login: Thu Apr 10 13:09:32 2025 from 45.14.193.140
user@example.com:~ $

content.text: SSH Options
Here are some common options you can use with the ssh command:
content.html: Here are some common options you can use with the ssh command:

content.text: Option: -p (Port)
The -p option lets you specify the port to connect to on the remote host.
content.html: The -p option lets you specify the port to connect to on the remote host.

content.text: By default, SSH uses port 22.

content.code_html:
ssh -p 2222 user@example.com
user@example.com's password:

content.text: Option: -i (Identity File)
The -i option allows you to specify a private key file for authentication.
content.html: The -i option allows you to specify a private key file for authentication.

content.text: This is useful when you have a specific key for a server.
content.html: This is useful when you have a specific key for a server.

content.code_html:
ssh -i /path/to/private_key user@example.com
user@example.com:~ $

content.text: Option: -v (Verbose Mode)
The -v option enables verbose mode, which provides detailed information about the SSH connection process.
content.html: The -v option enables verbose mode, which provides detailed information about the SSH connection process.

content.text: This is helpful for debugging.

content.code:
ssh
-v user@example.com
OpenSSH_9.6p1, OpenSSL 3.2.1 30 Jan 2024
debug1: Reading configuration data /home/users/.ssh/config
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: Connecting to example.com port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
.....
content.code_html:
ssh -v user@example.com
OpenSSH_9.6p1, OpenSSL 3.2.1 30 Jan 2024
debug1: Reading configuration data /home/users/.ssh/config
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: Connecting to example.com port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
.....

content.text: Option: -C (Compression)
The -C option enables compression, which can speed up data transfer by reducing the amount of data sent over the network.
content.html: The -C option enables compression, which can speed up data transfer by reducing the amount of data sent over the network.

content.code_html:
ssh -C user@example.com
user@example.com's password:

content.text: Option: -X (X11 Forwarding)
The -X option allows X11 forwarding, enabling you to run graphical applications on the remote server and display them locally.
content.html: The -X option allows X11 forwarding, enabling you to run graphical applications on the remote server and display them locally.

content.code_html:
ssh -X user@example.com
user@example.com's password:

content.text: Option: -o (Specify Options)
The -o option allows you to specify SSH options directly on the command line.
content.html: The -o option allows you to specify SSH options directly on the command line.

content.text: This is useful for overriding configuration settings.
content.html: This is useful for overriding configuration settings.

content.code:
ssh
-o
StrictHostKeyChecking
=
no user@example.com
user@example.com's password:
content.code_html:
ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no user@example.com
user@example.com's password:

content.text: Troubleshooting Common Issues
Common issues like "Connection Refused" or "Host Key Verification Failed" can occur. Here are some steps to troubleshoot these problems:
content.html: Common issues like "Connection Refused" or "Host Key Verification Failed" can occur. Here are some steps to troubleshoot these problems:
